column5: 6 am is real early in the morning but there I was meeting misfish for a few hours of flipping the banks..it was real cool.................the air I mean..dang cool out   and the fog rolling off the river..now that was cool...  fishing was slow but we did alright..nothing big                    I tried to catch misfish setting a hook on a fish buteverytime I set the camera down to fish he would catch one  here is a short vid of the fog and flipping     .  <embed width="448" height="361" type="application/x-shockwave-flash" wmode="transparent" src="http://i27.photobucket.com/player.swf?file=http://vid27.photobucket.com/albums/c177/Mrtbeee/flip.flv"></embed>
Nice Pics and Video. Fog looks very cool

Nice! I have really been enjoying all the catching up on reports since I was away. I am especially liking the videos. Keep up the good work!!  Oh and its nice to see how a pro works a shore line with a jig and pig! He is really working it at high speed and close to shore! I look forward to sharpening my skills with a jig and pig this year!
Nice report and images. Thanks for sharing.  Now I know where the misfish was today,  I looked for him hustling brats at BPS today.  John
LOL, great pictures and video, big dog and little dog?
Fantastic report Terry. Brian, watching that video tells me that could have become a world class symphony orchestra conductor the way you handle that baton.. Set it to music Terry.
Great work guys and nice work on the video Terry.  Thanks for the report.

Ver cool pic,s bud. When ya have time to do that vid ?Guess I should pay more attention to my guest.LOL  Johnny Im flatered but Im far from a pro at this stuff.You got to see the little guy set into them.  Morning John,things got a little heckdict here on Saturday so the bps trip was put on the back burner.Sunday afternoon was Kempinfest day with the mrs,s,well, after  a mornings fish.  I get that from me mudders side of the family Roy. Pops side had the over hand,if ya knows what I mean.HEHEHEHE   Terry never mentioned about the carp. There were thousands of them.Surfacing and it almost looked like they were gulpping for air,looked to me like they were dying. Terry on the other hand, thought maybe it was the algy bloom they were sucking back on,but man I never seen so many in such a long stretch.
oh yeah, I forgot about the thousands of carp that were doing something weird...  I had a good time on the water thanks
